results.title: The Jewel in the Crown. V.2. a Secret Vow
results.brief_description: Daphne Manners has fled to Kashmir carrying the half-caste child of Hari Kumar and hoping to bear his child in peace. But the unjust imprisonment of Hari Kumar haunts Daphne until Sarah Layton reveals the secrets that could ruin Lieutenant Merrick and free Hari Kumar.

results.title: The Jewel in the Crown. V.1. Incident at Mayapore
results.brief_description: It is 1942, India is in turmoil. The Japanese are poised to invade and the movement for independence is about to explode. This is the beginning of a story about the men and the women whose lives were irrevocably affected by the violence around them. Worlds collide in a land of magnificent beauty and turbulent passion. Rated: M

results.title: The Jerusalem passion
results.brief_description: Recorded live in the Concert Hall of the Queensland Performing Arts Complex on 9th April 1988. “The Jerusalem passion” was composed and conducted by Christian music director, Murray Wylie and features the Vision One Choir and Orchestra, supported by vocalists Sue Elliott, Jeff Baldock, David Hall, Helen Maguire, Jim McCrystal, Damien Roche, Julie Vidler and Kate Wylie. Playing the pipe organ is Eduarda Van Klinken and the oratorio is narrated by Helen Foster. Vision One is an Australia-wide Christian music initiative.

results.title: The Jazz Singer
results.creator_credit: Alan Crosland and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: A cantor’s son makes it big in show business. Archetypal Jewish weepie which became of absorbing interest as the first talkie film (songs and a few fragments of speech). Stars Al Jolson. Based on the play by Samson Raphaelson. Also includes a segment entitled “Behind the scenes” which documents the premiere of the film.

results.title: The Japanese press in action
results.brief_description: The busy world of newspaper production is surveyed. It briefly introduces the daily press of Japan and the role played by it in informing the public of news and comment from home and abroad.

results.title: The Japanese garden
results.creator_credit: Japan. National Tourist Organisation and DENTSU
results.brief_description: Atmospheric shots of misty valleys begin this stylised look at the natural beauties of the Japanese countryside and traditional gardens. Shows use of water and stone ornaments in formal gardens. Oriental music provides a complimentary background. No commentary.

results.title: The Janet Gardiner Case: Forensic Science at Work
results.brief_description: A dramatised film explaining, through the re-creation of a crime, the concept of forensic science and showing how the Forensic Section of the Police Department operates.

results.title: The Jamestown story
results.creator_credit: Karl Schiffman, Douglas Leiterman, Philip S. Hobel and Document Associates
results.brief_description: Focuses on Jamestown, a community with a history of strikes and labor troubles. Discusses an innovative program of labor management and co-operation that brought Jamestown back from the edge of economic disaster. Includes interviews with workers on the shop floor as well as managers.

results.title: The James Dean story: a different kind of motion picture
results.creator_credit: Robert Altman, George W. George and Hughes Leisure Group
results.brief_description: This is a special documentary movie on the life of one of Hollywood’s greatest legends - as told by his relatives, friends and fellow actors. The presence of James Dean in this film has been made possible by the use of existing motion picture material, tape recordings of his voice and by means of dynamic exploration of still photographs.
